title: Nutrition — Eating well, finding peak health, and the gut-brain connection simplified
description:
Transform your understanding of nutrition from confusing diet trends to evidence-based science. This comprehensive course takes you on a journey through the fascinating world of gut health, the microbiome, and the powerful gut-brain connection—guided by world-leading researchers from Stanford University, King's College London, and the University of Copenhagen. You'll learn from MDs, PhDs, professors, and registered dietitians who have dedicated their careers to understanding how what you eat shapes your physical health, mental well-being, and longevity. From foundational nutrition principles to cutting-edge nutrigenomics and personalized medicine, this course cuts through the noise to deliver what actually matters for your health.

You'll learn from an exceptional panel of 14 experts including Professor Tim Spector (top 1% most cited scientist directing the UK's largest microbiome study), Dr. Peter Attia (Stanford-trained longevity physician and bestselling author), Dr. Rhonda Patrick (PhD biomedical scientist), Stanford professors Dr. Lucia Aronica and Dr. Michael Snyder (leading nutrigenomics and genomics researchers), and many more accomplished scientists and clinicians. These aren't self-proclaimed gurus—they're researchers publishing in JAMA and Cell, professors at the world's top universities, and clinicians with decades of experience translating complex science into practical wisdom.

The course is carefully structured to build your knowledge progressively. You'll start with accessible foundations: why gut health matters, how to debunk diet myths, and the basics of metabolic health and probiotics. Then you'll advance to understanding mechanisms: the gut-brain connection, how polyphenols feed beneficial bacteria, what short-chain fatty acids do for your health, and how food directly impacts your mood and mental health. Finally, you'll explore the cutting edge: nutrigenomics (how your genes interact with food), metabolomics (studying the chemicals your gut bacteria produce), epigenetics (how nutrition turns genes on and off), and personalized nutrition based on your unique biology.

What makes this course trustworthy is the rigorous expert curation—every episode features a credentialed expert being interviewed (no solo rants or Wikipedia summaries), spanning 18 different podcasts for maximum diversity of perspectives. You'll finish this course not just knowing what to eat, but understanding why it matters at the cellular, metabolic, and genetic level—empowered with knowledge from the scientists who are literally writing the textbooks on nutrition, gut health, and the microbiome.
